1.text: And Job will answer and say,

2.text: Hearing, hear ye my speech, and this shall be your consolations.

3.text: Suffer me and I will speak; and after my word ye will mock.

4.text: I, is my complaint to man? and then wherefore shall not my spirit be shortened?

5.text: Look to me and be astonished, and put the hand upon the mouth.

6.text: And when I remembered and trembled, and horror took hold of my flesh.

7.text: Wherefore shall the unjust live? They grew old, also they were strong in power.

8.text: Their seed was established before their face with them, and their offspring before their eyes.

9.text: Their houses peace from fear, and the rod of God not upon them.

10.text: His ox passed over and will not be cast away: his heifer will escape and will not be barren.

11.text: They will send forth their children as a flock, and their children will leap.

12.text: They will lift up with the drum and harp, and they will rejoice at the voice of the pipe.

13.text: Their days glided on in good, and in a moment they will lay hold of hades.

14.text: And they will say to God, Depart from us; and we desired not the knowledge of thy ways.

15.text: What the Almighty that we shall serve him? and what shall we be profited if we shall supplicate to him?

16.text: Behold, their good not in the hand: the counsel of the unjust was far from me.

17.text: How often the light of the unjust shall be extinguished, and their destruction will come upon them. He will distribute pains in his anger.

18.text: They shall be as straw before the wind, and as chaff the storm stole it away.

19.text: God will lay up his iniquity for his sons: he will requite to him and be shall know.

20.text: His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink from the wrath of the Almighty.

21.text: For what his delight in his house after him, and the number of? his months were divided out?

22.text: Shall he teach knowledge to God? and he will judge those lifted up.

23.text: This shall die in the strength of his fulness, altogether tranquil and at rest.

24.text: His sides were filled with fat, and the marrow of his bones will, be moistened.

25.text: And this will die in the soul of bitterness, and will not eat in good.

26.text: They will lie down together upon the dust, and the worm shall cover over them.

27.text: Behold, I knew your purposes, and the devices ye will shake off against me.

28.text: For ye will say, Where the house of the noble one; and where the tent of the dwellings of the unjust?

29.text: Did ye not ask them passing over the way? and shall ye not know their signs?

30.text: For the evil one will be spared for the day of destruction; they shalt be led away to the day of wraths.

31.text: Who shall announce his way upon his face? and who shall requite to him that he did?

32.text: And he shall be led away to the graves, and shall watch over the tomb.

33.text: And the clods of the valley were sweet to him, and every man shall draw after him, and before him no number.

34.text: And how will ye comfort me in vain, and your answers remained treachery?
